President the President of India is
elected by the elected members of the
houses of parliament as well as the
elected members of the Legislative

Territories president is the head of
state he can summon or dissolve either

parliament begins its sessions the

Deputy Speaker judges of the Supreme
Court and High Court are appointed by
the president in consultation with the
Chief Justice of India Rajya Sabha the
Rajya Sabha

Election Commission of India India is
one of the largest democratic countries
of the world and the government is
elected by the people the task of
conducting elections is carried out by
the Election Commission of India this
permanent constitutional body was
established on 25th January 1950 the
Election Commission consists of a Chief
Election Commissioner and other
commissioners the Chief Election
Commissioner is the head of the Election
Commission of India and he or she is
appointed by the President of India from
October 1993 to more Election
Commissioner were also appointed they
have the same power and status as the
Chief Election Commissioner the decision
of the Commission can be challenged in
the High Court and Supreme Court of
India by appropriate petitions

India takes at least a month for the
general election any person uses citizen

the collector of each district is in

attendance of the highest government
office the resignation or death of the
Prime Minister dissolves the cabinet who
